column4: proprietary drive?. It would help if you described your problem and maybe linked to the output of this script (collects good data about alsa setup and function):  http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh (using "bash alsa-info.sh"), and upload directly or pastebin.
i try to pastebin the whole output from the script
if you choose Y during running, it will upload it automatically, or it creates a file in /tmp (it tells you at the end). You could pastebin that file.
i ran the script newly , here is the whole output: http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=13cb3380907ba9afa27a15bdbc9a62703edb0269
it looks fine. what's the problem? You may have to change Profile in Hardware tab of System->Preferences->Sound.
yes, all looks well after i installed the latest driver with the script. but, still no sound.
do you get sound with this command "speaker-test -c 2 -t wav" ?
i tried now all profiles under hardware tab, no success... also i tried to play a wav file with aplay, no sound. the speaker-test command is running now... but till now, no sound
i'm thinking either IEC958 setting in alsamixer/gnome-alsamixer or trying different audio ports. What jack/output are you attempting to get sound from?
in gnome-alsamixer it shows me a realtek ALC1200, the IEC958 is also selected. but the tab names ALC1200
ALC1200 is the codec which i found as i tried to figure out which card i really have.
the option there was to de-select IEC958, and try speakertest
i deselected the IEC in gnome alsamixer and now i try speakertest newly. but still nothing to hear from the speakers
how are your speakers connected? which port? sometimes the ports are mangled and you have to use the port called "Front"
the speakers are built in, it is a laptop...
